etymology.description: 大(大) (dà, "adult") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 子(子) (zǐ, "child") = transmit knowledge -> 大 corrupted to 矢(矢) (shǐ) for phonetic value, 子 was dropped -> final form 知
etymology.interpretation: 知(知) (zhī, "know") evolved from an original representation of transmitting knowledge from adults to children, which involved an adult speaking to a child. Over time, this depiction transformed into a simpler character with phonetic and semantic adaptations.

examples.chinese: 我知你的心意(我知你的心意)。
黄昏时分你归来(黃昏時分你歸來)，我立刻便知缘分(我立刻便知緣分)。
examples.pinyin: Huánghūn shífēn nǐ guīlái, wǒ lìkè biàn zhī yuánfèn.
examples.english: At dusk, when you return, I immediately know it is fate.
